page.title: 03THE CASTLE, LINCOLN.
page.content: The{Castle}was started in{1068}shortly after the {Norman Conquest,}to control the city for the invaders. The Castle has impressive walls, towers and gate- houses that now enclose the{County {Assize Court. After the violence of the medieval period and Civil War, the Castle was used as a{prison}and the buildings and courthouses remain.{Cobb Hall,}a medieval tower was used for dungeons whilst public hangings took place on its roof. Those hanged were buried in the old keep,{Lucy Tower.}The {prison {chapel }is a unique survival of the Victorian prison system. Each prisoner was locked into a separate compartment from where he could see the Chaplain but no-one else. Popular attractions include the{Civil {War siege }and a {Medieval Joust}and {Fayre}which attract many tourists.
